meanings.definition: A small channel or groove, especially one on the surface of a tooth.
meanings.sent1: The dentist cleaned the cantals of my teeth to remove any food particles.
meanings.sent2: I noticed some cantals on the edge of the wooden table.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse found a cozy spot in the cantals of the wall.
meanings.sent4: Her smile revealed cantals of happiness shining through.
meanings.sent5: The cantals on the road guided the rainwater towards the drain.

meanings.definition: A small ridge or raised area on a surface.
meanings.sent1: The hiker felt the cantals of the mountain beneath his feet.
meanings.sent2: The artist added cantals to the painting to create texture.
meanings.sent3: The cantals on the cake made it look like a mini mountain range.
meanings.sent4: The cantals of the field resembled waves frozen in time.
meanings.sent5: The cantals on the fabric gave it a unique tactile quality.

meanings.definition: A small corner or niche in a room or building.
meanings.sent1: She placed a vase in the cantals of the room to brighten it up.
meanings.sent2: The cat found a cozy spot in the cantals of the bookshelf.
meanings.sent3: The spider built its web in the cantals of the ceiling.
meanings.sent4: The cantals of the garden shed held hidden treasures.
meanings.sent5: The cantals of the attic were filled with forgotten memories.
